docs.lead_paragraph: Perhaps the biggest surprise the Obama administration has faced in its first 100 days has not been the dismal state of the economy or the difficulties abroad with Afghanistan, Iran and Pakistan, but rather the grudging cooperation of the Democratic Congress.

headline.main: Can Obama Be a Majority of One?

docs.abstract: The president could take a lesson from L.B.J. on how to bend fractious Congressional Democrats to his will.
docs.snippet: The president could take a lesson from L.B.J. on how to bend fractious Congressional Democrats to his will.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was a Kansas-fest this morning as the first of two hearings began on the confirmation of Gov. Kathleen Sebelius to become the administration's secretary of health and human services.
docs.abstract: The governor from Kansas appears at the first of two hearings this week as her candidacy to become health and human services secretary moves forward.

docs.lead_paragraph: The municipal governing body members of the Board of School Estimate voted 4-2 tonight to approve the Board of Education's $97.9 million tax levy, representing a 3.98 percent increase over the 2008-09 budget.

headline.main: Cuts Are Avoided as the SOM School Budget Passes

docs.lead_paragraph: As an assertion of government control over a huge swath of the industrial landscape, President Obama's decision to reshape the automobile industry has few precedents.

headline.main: For U.S. and Carmakers, a Path Strewn With Pitfalls

docs.abstract: As an assertion of government control over a huge swath of the industrial landscape, President Obama's decision to reshape the automobile industry has few precedents. In essentially taking command of General Motors and telling Chrysler to merge with a foreign competitor or cease to exist, Mr. Obama was saying that economic conditions were sufficiently dire [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Medical histories are among the most sensitive of our sensitive personal information. And our details have been spread from here to, well, all over the place -- doctors' offices, hospital archives, pharmacies, labs, billing companies and insurers' computer networks.

headline.main: A How-To Guide to Keeping Medical Records Private

docs.abstract: A guide released today by the World Privacy Forum helps citizens gain control over the baffling world of medical records.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama announced what amounts to a do-or-die ultimatum for the struggling automobile industry on Monday, laying out strict standards that the carmakers must meet to get more government aid and declaring that the industry must survive because it is "like no other, an emblem of the American spirit," The New York Times's Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Bill Vlasic report.

docs.lead_paragraph: Concluding the most secretive budget negotiations in recent memory, Gov. David A. Paterson and leaders of the Legislature outlined a $131.8 billion agreement on Sunday that would close the state's gaping deficit with billions of dollars in new taxes, financing from the federal stimulus and a substantial slowdown in the growth of health care spending.

headline.main: Budget Deal Reached After Secretive Talks
